website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, well-made post driver of average weight. Users rarely voice complaints; it's a well-received product that can make your life easier.
pros: can be driven into soft rock

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I hoped for. Solidly built. Does a surprisingly good job of driving posts even into soft rock, especially if your only other frame of reference is a sledge hammer. You'll never go back. Someone asked if it fits over a terminal post, and it's hard to say for sure, but it might. Fits easily over regular chainlink posts. It's marked 16lbs on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Small

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The driver is very sturdy and I ran into no problems using it. Way easier than using a sledge or mallet. I have very rocky ground and while this doesn't allow me to put a post ANYWHERE it at least will help me push through some rocks I otherwise would not have been able to.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Great driving tool
customer_reviews.text: Bang bang away... Tip one or two inches below top of pipe put a marker line.. why else could hurt yourself if lift off pipe and slam down in one motion... neighbor told me his horror story so I did it and seemed to help. Set eight pipe for dock in no time... Make sure you have a refreshment handy cause you will be tired.
customer_reviews.author: ajw

customer_reviews.title: Where Have You Been All Of My Life
customer_reviews.text: Every year I have used a sledgehammer to drive stakes into the ground for my tomatoes and fencing. I saw one of these in a YouTube video and decided to give it a try. All I can say is "Where Have You Been All Of My Life!!" No more damaged poles, no more aching arms and shoulders. I love this post driver
customer_reviews.author: David Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Works great but watch out for packaging!
customer_reviews.text: This post driver itself works fine and its bright orange color makes it hard to lose on my farm. I'm very happy with it. BUT this heavy item with a sharp pointed end arrived in a too-large and too-thin cardboard box with no filler or cushioning. By the time I received it from the UPS delivery man, it had broken out of its box with the pointed end showing. So, as he handed it over and was shaking his head in dismay, I apologized for the shipper's lack of thought and promised him that I'd provide feedback on this point! Please greatly improve the packaging to prevent this potentially dangerous item from doing damage to humans or property during shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Dr S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Post Driver
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I set about 20 posts in 30 minutes using this thing. It's a great workout. The weight is just enough to get the posts pounded in, but light enough that you don't get worn out after the first 2. Definitely make sure you have ear protection as the clanging is pretty loud!
customer_reviews.author: AcesOfTheSpades

customer_reviews.title: Why would anyone ever use a hammer?
customer_reviews.text: Update January 2020. As I mentioned in my original review I think this thing will last a lifetime. I have owned it for more than 3 1/2 years and it still looks and functions like brand new. Original review July 2017. This is a steel tube with a weight welded at the top. All you do is slam it down on your posts and it drives it into the ground. This has no moving parts and is solidly constructed. This should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use , even in rocky ground .
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband now 76 yrs of age who always drives posts by a sledge hammer . It was time to try to ease his labors . He was skeptical , but after using it he admitted it was one of my best shopping choices , and agreed it was easier than using a sledge .
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Predebon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This driver works much better than a sledge hammer and it is easy on the body. I used it to drive 7 ft lugged U metal fence posts as well as a grounding rod and it worked very well. It seems to drive through rocks in the soil.
customer_reviews.author: JOFFRE R LEVESQUE

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, it definitely has the action & weight behind ...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, it definitely has the action & weight behind it to drive posts into ground, even with my little chicken arms. My man used it as well and found it easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Product-  USE EAR PROTECTION
customer_reviews.text: I was using a sledge hammer beofre, aside from jarring my teeth on every swing it was slow and painful. This baby is well built and drives a post in no time. WEAR EAR PROTECTION WHEN USING...the metal against metal reverberation in the barrel is LOUD. I had a rining in my ears for a while the first time, now its ear protection.
customer_reviews.author: Constance Rowan

customer_reviews.title: good weight to it
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, good weight to it. Not a fan of the slant cut bottom. It makes the driver unidirectional, you can only safely use it with the long end facing you and the handles are bent to accommodate that. Other than that, it does what it says.
customer_reviews.author: Enscribe

customer_reviews.title: To short, to light
customer_reviews.text: This t post driver is way to light and way to short to do any real work. Buy a better kne6, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Holt

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. well built. i have used it to drive wooden grade steaks and ground rods. works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Seems Like well Made Product
customer_reviews.text: Snow came earlier that planned in Tahoe so I missed my window to use. I expect this will make the job a lot easier when I get to it but I am still not looking forward to pinding away.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Leunig

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool. Plenty heavy to drive 2 x 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. Plenty heavy to drive 2 x 2 wooden stakes and metal T-posts. Easy to grab while driving the posts. Not sure how it compares to the ones that have gotten lesser reviews due to not being heavy enough. Wouldn't want it too much heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Beat the heck out of using an 8 pound sledge ...
customer_reviews.text: Beat the heck out of using an 8 pound sledge from the top of a ladder to pound in 7 foot T stakes for a fence!!
customer_reviews.author: RonB

customer_reviews.title: Works well, paint was chipped.
customer_reviews.text: It drives posts well, and it has a nice sized opening so they fit. It arrived with some paint chipped off. It should realy matter though since I'm sure I'll chip off more driving steel posts with it.
customer_reviews.author: keith Pronko

customer_reviews.title: This little gem works as it supposed to. Sure ...
customer_reviews.text: This little gem works as it supposed to. Sure make pounding in stakes in the garden a lot easier than with a hammer or the back end of a axe. I only wish that I had known about this and bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Call

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction. Turned out radius too small for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction. Turned out radius too small for my needs but I think this could do the job quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved me a lot of pain, time, and money!
customer_reviews.text: This saves me a ton of time! I used to use a hammer to pound t posts in. Not anymore! It takes me about 45 seconds instead of 4 minutes and sore arms!
customer_reviews.author: FridayMorningFika

customer_reviews.title: Save time and effort
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I put in 30 posts in about an hour. Surprisingly I wasn't as sore as I thought I'd be lifting and using it. The reason for 4 stars is that it was simply in a box with some paper wrapped around it and when the delivery people dropped (literally since I heard it) on the porch some of the finish chipped off. It doesn't affect the tool but I may need to watch for rust down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tromans

customer_reviews.title: Just the ticket for driving steel posts
customer_reviews.text: I received the post driver in perfect condition. It is exactly what I expected and it worked very well for my application - driving a 4ft long, 2in diameter steel posts 2ft into hard clay soil.
customer_reviews.author: R Howell

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find one where we lived, very well made
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find where we live, and expensive, happy when it came, excellent quality an construction
customer_reviews.author: ndavicourt

customer_reviews.title: Post driver
customer_reviews.text: This post driver works very well to secure fence posts.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia N

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. Easy to use and not as heavy as some I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beats using a hammer to drive stakes. My husband loves it.
customer_reviews.author: lynda winslow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is. It drives post as expected
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt ThompsonTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for t posts
customer_reviews.text: I needed to put in 45 8 foot t posts, and this thing made it a fairly easy job. A friend of mine mentioned I should get one, and amazon had the best price I could find. I did watch a you tube video on using it and they pointed out the need for ear protection when using it, and that is a must
customer_reviews.author: Dan Crouse

customer_reviews.title: It is a great product. Its weight is about what an average ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product. Its weight is about what an average person can operate, and it can drive any kind of fence post.
customer_reviews.author: Bor-yaw Lin

customer_reviews.title: dose the job fine though the welding is a bit sloppy the metal ...
customer_reviews.text: dose the job fine though the welding is a bit sloppy the metal peace where you strike your post is fairly thick, it appears to be stick welded in place with a penetrating electrode, a bit poorly done and the slag was not removed My complaints are quite minor though. I was able to drive a 1 1/4 well point down over 20 feet with it with no issue though the soil here is fairly loose.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Best one
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, handle shape is much better than the square one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works like it's suppose to. Saved my back and hands from swinging the sledge hammer!
customer_reviews.author: coastee

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple tool that saves a lot of work. I could have easily welded one up myself but decided the material and time it would take wasn't worth it. Not much to go wrong with this product and it drives in the posts as described. If you have a lot of posts to drive, spend the money and get a hydraulic unit for about $400. If you just need to do a few, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Does just what you expect it to do! Thirteen ...
customer_reviews.text: Does just what you expect it to do! Thirteen pounds is just enough when you are pitting in a lot of posts.
customer_reviews.author: John C Packer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: High quality, quite heavy. Made the job of setting the stakes a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Russell S. Bundy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wear ear, hand and eye protection when using equipment of all kinds. Safety tip of the day.
customer_reviews.author: AlexP

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what the doctor ordered. I was going to rent one but with this price it was exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: B & B

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's kind of light duty for a driver but effective
customer_reviews.author: BRENDON DOWNEY

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I considered putting in a fence without this. It's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Beats the heck out of using a sledgehammer -- Especially if you're working alone.
customer_reviews.author: Spincenter

customer_reviews.title: Great driver.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and does exactly what it's supposed to do. Haven't used it enough yet to know that it'll really take a pounding though, but it definitely feels like it will. Connective welds feel secure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can say I like the angle cut on the bottom which may make ...
customer_reviews.text: It looks well made BUT I haven't used it yet. I'll submit another review after I have used it. I can say I like the angle cut on the bottom which may make it easier to put on and take off the post.
customer_reviews.author: SugarBaby

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Does what it should. Would buy again if I needed too!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!! I'm a city girl that's obsessed with landscaping and gardening. After borrowing my father-in-laws, I realized I needed my own because I was tired of sharing it with him. Lol. I bought a red one on here and used it all last year. I can't find it though so ordered this orange one since I like the orange. It's pretty heavy and gets the job done. I've used it to install fencing around trees, fence around our garden and to make trellises. The deer are trying to ruin my country experience on our other property.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Yost

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little tool!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to pull old posts because someone said even a grandma could use it. I’m a grandma and it was easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: L. Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Bought 1 came with 2
customer_reviews.text: I Havnt used this yet but it came with two. Not sure if that's a good thing or not. Looks solid!
customer_reviews.author: GPM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I need, right to my doorstep in 2 days! Amazing! Excellent Quality!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Forster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Light weight enough for a woman to use, strong enough for a man to abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tee post driver. Easy to get on and off the post
customer_reviews.author: sharlyn stufflebeam

product_meta.title: Koch Industries 4075233 Post Driver with Handle
product_meta.description: Koch chain, wire and accessories are all manufactured to the highest specifications for quality. They are durable and easy to use in many application on the farm and in construction.
feature_bullets: Easy grip handle makes driving posts into the ground more effective
Heavy gauge steel construction for durability
Powder coat finish in high visibility orange

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars123 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
